text:
League 1
Rennes: Deschamps tempers for Camavinga
In a press conference, Didier Deschamps was questioned on the case of Eduardo Camavinga recently naturalized French, after having the list of the Team of France.
07 Nov 2019, 14:40 by Charlie Creteur



16-year-old Eduardo Camavinga, staggering with Stade Rennais from Steve Mandanda to Memphis Depay, to the young Eduardo Camavinga, several individuals emerged from the lot this weekend, on the occasion of the second day of Ligue 1. Icon Sport Overview



Steve Mandanda (OM) Icon Sport



Creole Maouassa (Rennes) Icon Sport



Jason Denayer (OL) Icon Sport



Jeremy Gelin (Rennes) Icon Sport



Julien Faussurier (Brest) Icon Sport



Houssem Aouar (OL) Icon Sport



Eduardo Camavinga (Rennes) Icon Sport



Renaud Cohade (Metz) Icon Sport



Memphis Depay (OL) Icon Sport



Habib Diallo (Metz) Icon Sport



Denis Bouanga (Saint-Etienne) Icon Sport

Mandanda, Camavinga, Memphis, ... the typical team of the weekend in Ligue 1




It is now done, Eduardo Camavinga has obtained the French nationality! Thus, the middle of 16 years in Teams of France. Asked about it after unveiling his roster for the Euro 2020 qualifiers, Didier Deschamps asked for patience for the young rennais.




"Camavinga will have steps to take"




Didier Deschamps + 12 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

"It's going fast for him," he said. "It's a very good thing for him and for French football, we're talking about a player who can do very good things with Rennes, he's practically a holder, and he'll have to go through too. He seems to want to come with us at one point, but there are other selections, especially hopes, where he may be concerned. "
